lines.text: I had an uncle. He played bagpipes in the shriners band. He couldn't play a note, but nobody could tell the difference.

[points to his head]
You can't get a search warrant for what's in here.
You couldn't get bus fare for what's in there!
Oh, Jerry. I didn't know you were in town.
I had to rush home, do some local promotion for my new book.
Oh, another book? Who's bedroom did you pry into THIS time.
You know, Miss Chandler, if anybody ever told me I'd be standing here... I mean, right face-to-face with you... I mean, I've been in love with you all my life.
I know. You never expected to meet a legend.
Now, what have you told the police?
What is there to tell? That you tried to kill me? That would be like disposing of the goose who owes me a golden egg.
Her dear, departed husband would be spinning in his grave... if he had one.
You know, a part of me really didn't want 'em to add up.
You understand, Miss Chandler, the only reason your poor secretary is dead is because somebody made a terrible mistake last night.

[sitting at Nora's bar after she has poured herself a drink]
Aren't you gonna pour me one?
Buy your own!

[to Columbo]
Actors, Lieutenant. Take my advice - avoid actors. They'll kill ya.
Hey, Lieutenant, did you ever think of getting another car?
Yeah, but I got another car. My wife drives it. Of course, it's nothing special. Just for transportation.

[to Columbo]
I would never typecast you as a detective, either.
Oh, Lieutenant, I thought you wanted to use the phone.
Yeah, but I was just gonna call my wife and she's probably still talking, so...
And, Lieutenant, as for you, you have an obtuse manner which some people find ingratiating. I do not. Do you follow me?
